page.title: 17THE CHAPEL, NEAR FUNTINGTON
page.content: In 1861 Chichester Cathedral's spire collapsed. Some of the stone was used to build a Congregational{Chapel}where the B2146 road meets the B2178 between East Ashling and Funtington. The first service in 1864 used text 1 Peter 2,7 {The stone which the builders rejected {as worthless turned out to be the most {important of all.}It had a Sunday school.It closed as a Chapel and might have become a garage. It is let to the local{Scouts}who meet on Fridays. The Cubs meet on Thursdays. Still called The Chapel it has the old narrow Funtington-Chichester road on one side The wider straighter faster new road opened in 1967 on the other. The building is 14m by 10m and over 6m high with a slate roof. On the south side are 6 windows with 4 more and double-doors on the other. The scouts have an activity area nearby.
